basics.name: Rui Chen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

highlights: Developed and optimized web applications using React and Next.js, focusing on responsive interfaces, state management, and seamless client-server communication.
Refactored and implemented RESTful APIs with a Java backend, ensuring smooth integration and robust performance for frontend applications.

work.summary: Formally verified the correctness of an OCaml-based file system using Isabelle
highlights: Modeled and proved system invariants and properties, ensuring file operations and data integrity
Validated block-level management to guarantee consistent and error-free behavior

volunteer.summary: Digitization specialist for plant specimen collections
highlights: Classify and catalog large collections of plant specimens
Photograph and digitize specimens to create online archives for researchers and the public
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: The Arakawa Science, Technology Engineering and Math Endowed Scholarship
awards.summary: Glen Y. Arakawa, a 1969 UH College of Engineering graduate, built a career in radar systems and microelectronics before transitioning to real estate investment in 1982. A strong supporter of STEM education, he established a scholarship endowment to assist future scientists and engineers.
